data.name: Blaine's Quiz #3
rules: Put a Basic or Evolution card from your hand face down in front of you and tell your opponent the name of an attack of that card. Your opponent guesses the name of that card. Flip the card over. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 3 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 3 cards. Either way, return the card to your hand.

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Grand Flame
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Darkrai LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Darkrai. Darkrai LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Dark Shadow
abilities.text: Each basic Darkness Energy card attached to your Darkness Pokémon now has the effect "If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance)." You can't use more than 1 Dark Shadow Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Endless Darkness
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. Flip 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, the Defending Pokémon is still Asleep. If both of them are tails, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

data.name: Cassius
rules: Shuffle 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Wally
rules: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-EX) and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward. You can use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Brock's Grit
rules: Shuffle 6 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Vermilion City Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

Whenever a player attacks with a Pokémon with Lt. Surge in its name, he or she may flip a coin. If heads, and if that Pokémon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, the attacking Pokémon does 10 damage to itself in addition to whatever its attack usually does.

data.name: Shauna
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Talonflame

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Loop-the-Loop
attacks.text: Put all Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.flavorText: Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek. It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them firmly in its talons.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon.

data.name: Armaldo

attacks.name: Ancient Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Unidentified Fossil card in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.flavorText: It lived on land and went out into the sea to hunt for prey. Its sharp claws were its greatest weapon.

data.name: Axew
data.flavorText: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

data.name: Darkness Energy
rules:
If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon. At the end of every turn, put 1 damage counter on the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to, unless it's Darkness or has Dark in its name.
Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Clobbopus
data.flavorText: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

data.name: Gyarados-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stormy Seas
attacks.text: Flips a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Splash Burn
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Beast Ring
rules: You can play this card only if your opponent has exactly 3 or 4 Prize cards remaining.
Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Ultra Beasts. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Stonjourner

attacks.name: Power Press
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun's descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.

data.name: Buneary
data.flavorText: By extending its rolled up ears and striking the ground, it can bound so high it surprises itself.

data.name: Pokédex HANDY910is
rules: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

data.name: Sandile

attacks.name: Dredge Up
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: Sandile's still not good at hunting, so it mostly eats things that have collapsed in the desert. It's called "the cleaner of the desert."

data.name: Yungoos
data.flavorText: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.

data.name: Servine

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

data.name: Pokémon Fan Club
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Counter Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.

If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, and if this card is attached to a Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 2 Energy at a time.

data.name: PlusPower
rules: Attach PlusPower to your Active Pokémon. At the end of your turn, discard PlusPower. If this Pokémon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Crobat V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dark Asset
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. You can't use more than 1 Dark Asset Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Shining Noctowl
rules: You can't have more than 1 Shining Noctowl in your deck.

attacks.name: Flashing Eyes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If exactly 1 is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If exactly 2 are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If all 3 are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It speeds up its thought processes by turning its head around 180 degrees.

data.name: Entei ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Burning Turn
attacks.text: Switch Entei Star with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Detonation
attacks.text: If you have less Prize cards left than your opponent, discard the top 10 cards from your deck.

data.name: Sneasel ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Beat Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each of your Pokémon in play (including Sneasel ex). This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Latios-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mach Flight
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Bunnelby

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

data.name: Mr. Mime ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Magic Evens
abilities.text: If Mr. Mime ex would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Mr. Mime ex if that damage is 20, 40, 60, 80, 100, 120, 140, 160, or 180.

attacks.name: Breakdown
attacks.text: Count the number of cards in your opponent's hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Salamence ex δ
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Type Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Salamence ex's type is Fire until the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Dual Stream
attacks.text: You may do up to 40 damage instead of 80 to the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Crabrawler

attacks.name: Knuckle Blast
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.

data.name: Groudon ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Critical Collection
attacks.text: Count the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken. Search your discard pile for up to that many Fighting Energy cards and attach them to Groudon Star.

attacks.name: Ground Slash
attacks.text: Discard a Fighting Energy card attached to Groudon Star.

data.name: Gyarados Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Gyarados-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Alolan Exeggutor

attacks.name: Paradise Draw
attacks.text: You may discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Egg Splat
attacks.text: Discard any number of Exeggcute from your hand. This attack does 60 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: Exeggutor is the pride of the Alolan people. Its image is carved into historical buildings and murals.

data.name: Flying Pikachu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Flying Pikachu during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: By learning how to fly, Pikachu overcame its weakness to Fighting Pokémon.

data.name: Minccino

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They great one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

data.name: Growlithe

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Growlithe.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

data.name: Oddish

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

data.name: Loudred

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

data.name: Blaine's Gamble
rules: Discard any number of other cards from your hand, then flip a coin. If heads, draw twice that many cards.

data.name: Diancie

attacks.name: Sparkle
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Diamond Storm
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Fairy Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Open the magic door and a dream-colored party will start again today. I'll teach you the secret password.

data.name: Pokémon Center
rules: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

data.name: Steel Shelter
rules: Each Metal Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't be affected by any Special Conditions. (Remove any Special Conditions affecting those Pokémon.)
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Kyogre ★
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Critical Collection
attacks.text: Count the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken. Search your discard pile for up to that many Water Energy cards and attach them to Kyogre Star.

attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 miles per hour.

data.name: Reshiram

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

data.name: Professor Sycamore
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Lopunny

attacks.name: Healing Melody
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 60 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Kick Away
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.

data.name: Dratini

attacks.name: Dragon Rage
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It's still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.
